pages.title: SOX Compliance Overview
pages.content:
# SOX Compliance Project

This project tracks Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) compliance for IT systems supporting financial reporting.

## Objectives

- Ensure IT General Controls (ITGCs) are in place
- Implement change management procedures
- Maintain access controls for financial systems
- Document compliance efforts
- Support external audit requirements

children.title: Scope
children.content:
## Scope

This compliance effort covers:

- Financial reporting systems
- Database systems storing financial data
- Access control and authentication systems
- Change management processes
- Backup and recovery procedures
- Segregation of duties controls

pages.title: IT General Controls
pages.content:
# IT General Controls (ITGCs)

ITGCs are the foundation of SOX compliance for IT systems.

## Key Control Areas

1. **Access Controls** - Logical access to systems and data
2. **Change Management** - Control over system changes
3. **Computer Operations** - Backup, recovery, and monitoring
4. **System Development** - Controls over new system development

policy_templates.title: Access Control Policy
policy_templates.description: Access control requirements for financial systems
policy_templates.content:
# Access Control Policy

## Purpose

Ensure appropriate access controls are in place for systems supporting financial reporting.

## Scope

All systems that store, process, or transmit financial data.

## Requirements

### 1. User Access Management

- All users must have unique user IDs
- Access must be granted based on job responsibilities
- Access requests must be approved by management
- Access must be reviewed quarterly
- Terminated users must have access revoked immediately

### 2. Privileged Access

- Privileged access must be restricted to authorized personnel
- Privileged actions must be logged
- Privileged access must be reviewed monthly
- Shared privileged accounts are prohibited

### 3. Segregation of Duties

- Incompatible duties must be separated
- No single individual should have end-to-end control over financial transactions
- Segregation of duties conflicts must be identified and mitigated

### 4. Password Management

- Minimum password length: 12 characters
- Password complexity requirements must be enforced
- Passwords must be changed every 90 days
- Password reuse is prohibited (last 12 passwords)
- Multi-factor authentication required for financial systems

## Monitoring

- Access logs must be reviewed weekly
- Unauthorized access attempts must be investigated
- Access violations must be reported to management

policy_templates.title: Change Management Policy
policy_templates.description: Change control procedures for financial systems
policy_templates.content:
# Change Management Policy

## Purpose

Ensure all changes to financial systems are properly authorized, tested, and documented.

## Scope

All changes to production systems supporting financial reporting.

## Requirements

### 1. Change Request Process

- All changes must be documented in a change request
- Change requests must include business justification
- Changes must be approved by appropriate authority
- Emergency changes must be documented and approved retroactively

### 2. Change Approval

**Standard Changes:**
- Require approval from IT management
- Must be reviewed by change advisory board (CAB)

**High-Risk Changes:**
- Require approval from IT management and business owner
- Must be reviewed by CAB and senior management

**Emergency Changes:**
- Require approval from on-call manager
- Must be reviewed by CAB within 24 hours

### 3. Testing Requirements

- All changes must be tested in non-production environment
- Test results must be documented
- User acceptance testing (UAT) required for significant changes
- Regression testing required for system updates

### 4. Implementation

- Changes must be implemented during approved maintenance windows
- Rollback procedures must be documented and tested
- Implementation must be monitored
- Post-implementation review required within 48 hours

### 5. Documentation

- Change requests must be retained for 7 years
- Implementation documentation must be complete
- Configuration changes must be documented
- Version control must be maintained

## Monitoring

- Unauthorized changes must be detected and investigated
- Change success rate must be tracked
- Change-related incidents must be analyzed

policy_templates.title: Backup and Recovery Policy
policy_templates.description: Data backup and disaster recovery requirements
policy_templates.content:
# Backup and Recovery Policy

## Purpose

Ensure financial data can be recovered in the event of system failure or disaster.

## Scope

All systems containing financial data.

## Requirements

### 1. Backup Procedures

**Frequency:**
- Full backups: Weekly
- Incremental backups: Daily
- Transaction log backups: Every 4 hours (for databases)

**Backup Types:**
- Database backups
- File system backups
- Configuration backups
- Application backups

**Backup Storage:**
- Backups must be stored off-site
- Backups must be encrypted
- Backup media must be secured
- Backup retention: 7 years for financial data

### 2. Recovery Procedures

**Recovery Time Objective (RTO):**
- Critical financial systems: 4 hours
- Important financial systems: 24 hours
- Standard systems: 48 hours

**Recovery Point Objective (RPO):**
- Critical financial systems: 1 hour
- Important financial systems: 4 hours
- Standard systems: 24 hours

**Testing:**
- Recovery procedures must be tested quarterly
- Test results must be documented
- Failed tests must be remediated immediately

### 3. Disaster Recovery

- Disaster recovery plan must be documented
- DR plan must be tested annually
- DR site must be maintained
- DR procedures must be updated as systems change

## Monitoring

- Backup success must be verified daily
- Failed backups must be investigated immediately
- Backup integrity must be tested monthly
